Buchanan Elementary parents:

As I’m sure you’ve noticed, we do not have fulltime crossing guards this year due to COVID and the strict guidelines we need to follow. We have had some help in the mornings and have just recently put a “state law, yield to pedestrians” sign at the crosswalk on Capital Avenue.

The good news is we will be getting a flashing light installed at the crosswalk (on Capital Avenue) to stop traffic when students are crossing. Students simply push the button and the light will blink rapidly to notify traffic to stop; just like the one on the truck route and Euclid Avenue. The materials for this light are due to arrive this week and we expect this to be installed right away. Thank you for your patience and helping your students cross the street safely in the meantime. Have a great week!

Tomorrow’s the big day!

We’ve heard from many teachers and staff who are ready and excited to welcome our kids back to school. What a great day tomorrow will be!! 🤩

A few reminders:

👉🏻 Only students and staff are allowed in the school at this time.

👉🏻 Parents/Guardians, please remain in your vehicles at pick up and drop off.

👉🏻 Students are to enter the building through specific doors if dropped off between 7:50 and 8:00 AM. Those door assignments are located near the class lists on the front door of the school. Please take time to review that information before drop off tomorrow morning!

👉🏻 Teachers and staff will be outside and on the playground the next few mornings to help our kiddos. We know, love, and trust our teachers - they will take care of our kids and get them to where they need to be! 🤗

👉🏻 While masks are not mandatory, they are strongly encouraged.

👉🏻 Although none of us know what this year will hold, the Buchanan PTA is gearing up for a great year! We hope you and your kiddos have a safe, healthy, and fun 2020-2021 school year! 👍🏻

shared_text:
River Cities Public Transit
July 15, 2019 at 4:00 PM ·

Back to school ALREADY! We are down to 1 month away until Youth Registration starting back up.
We have several updates this year:
1. $2 per ride per child pre-scheduled (only exception is Kidstop). If your ride is over 10 miles in length there will be $.25 charge per mile.
2. RCPT will need everyone to bring in your Youth Transit Fare Cards to get re-stamped.
3. RCPT will have a cutoff for Youth Registration forms on August 12th for those that want to have their child ride the first week of school. The next day to start riding will be August 26th.
4. Those that do not get registered by the time the buses fill up will be put on a wait list.
5. Parents will be able to see in real-time where their child's bus is on the Shah My-ride App.
6. Please see our website for more details about our new updates.
